Event.name: Fleeing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Self_mover</fen> responds to a (real or imagined) danger by moving away from it.
<ex><fex name="Self_mover">She</fex> had <t>fled</t> <fex name="Source">from DCS facilities</fex> several times before..</ex> <ex><fex name="Self_mover">Pakistanis in US</fex> trying to <t>flee</t> <fex name="Goal">to Canada</fex> hit roadblocks.</ex> <ex><fex name="Self_mover">Anderson's division</fex> suddenly <t>bolted</t> <fex name="Direction">north</fex> <fex name="Source">from Devil's Den</fex>, flanked out III Corps almost entirely, and shattered the entire Corps.</ex> <ex><fex name="Self_mover">We</fex> <t>fled</t> <fex name="Distance">for several miles</fex> before reaching our safe-house.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Self_mover
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living (or self-directed) being which moves under its own power. </def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. </def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion involving a landmark which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>. This includes "middle of path'' expressions. </def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory or rate of motion. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions.
<ex>They had to <t>flee</t> <fex name="Manner">on foot</fex> through the desert.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Distance</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time when the motion occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cotheme
Arg.definition: <def-root>An entity whose motion is correlated with that of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, following and tracking the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, being followed and tracked, or with both parties mutually matching <fen>Path</fen>s. </def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>The rate at which the location of the <fen>Self_mover</fen> changes with respect to time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act whereby the <fen>Self_mover</fen> achieves movement. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world which exists because of the motion of the <fen>Self_mover</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Internal_cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The emotional or mental state of the <fen>Self_mover</fen> which motivates them toward motion or the particular manner of motion.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moves.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which a <fen>Self_mover</fen> moves. <ex>John <t>ran</t> <t>away</t> with her <fex name="Purpose">to shelter her from disapproval</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place. Any specified or implied <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of affairs that leads to the particular motion that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> adopts.
</def-root>

Arg.name: External_cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>External_cause</fen> is something in the external environment that causes the <fen>Self_mover</fen> to move.
<ex>They <t>fled</t> <fex name="ext">at the sound of her voice</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.definition: <def-root>The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion. </def-root>

Arg.name: Means_of_motion
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity used by the <fen>Self_mover</fen> in getting away from the undesirable <fen>Source</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: flee.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: escape the site of a disaster.

lexUnit.name: flight.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of leaving a place suddenly
